comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: A3D-1 or YA3D-1 Skywarrior Bu No 135408 NATC (Naval Air Test Center) on very dark painted tail. Outer wing also in dark color. Dark surround on engine intake. Large side code 408. Lettering below cockpit. Early thin cockpit framing, fairing for periscope beneath forward fuselage, rear radar and gun turret. Early wing with leading edge slats only on outer wing. The sixteenth Skywarrior to be built, it was accepted by US Navy in July 1955. The NATC tested all Skywarrior versions, right from 5 Nov 1954 with a prototype XA3D-1. YA3D-1 135408 was used for carrier suitability trials from Sept. 1956 until June 1957. In January 1960 the aircraft was lost over the sea during a training mission in wintertime. Scrapped after inflight accident while serving with VAH-123, the A3D/A-3B Replacement Training unit Record of loss taken from this dedicated 'A-3 Skywarrior Association' website: www.a3skywarrior.com/memorial/full_accident_date.htm VAH 123. 135408. 1/4/1960 (4th Jan 1960) 11 nm from NAS Whidbey, Washington state. Compressor stall in flight. Icing at 3000 ft. Aircraft lost at sea. It was carrying four crew. From the injury codes provided it is not known if they survived. Two pictures of A3D-1 135408 during its use as a test and development plane: a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=101759&s=gl&media_... "Suitability Trials" Carrier trials being conducted aboard USS Forrestal on 4/4/56. Skywarriors are A3D-1s, BuNo 135408 & 135411. They have mixed blue and gray paint jobs. Photo provided by Harry Gann. www.aahs-online.org/journals/jrnl_image.php?jrnl=v51n4&am... A3D-1, BuNo 135408, on catapult awaiting flight. Note wings and fin folded with jury strut supporting fin in folded position. (Douglas photo)
